intro: Schindleria mollis, commonly known as the glasswort, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. Schindleria mollis thrives in wet, saline environments such as marshes and coastal areas. Its ability to tolerate high salinity makes it an important species in ecological studies of salt-tolerant plants.
